To send Glances data to InfluxDB so that it can be monitored from Grafana, you can use the Glances InfluxDB export plugin. This plugin allows you to export Glances data to InfluxDB in real-time, where it can be visualized in Grafana.

Here are the steps to set up Glances InfluxDB export plugin:

1. Install Glances: If you haven't already, you will need to install Glances on the system you want to monitor.
2. Install the InfluxDB Python library: The Glances InfluxDB export plugin requires the InfluxDB Python library to be installed. You can install it using pip:
```
pip install influxdb
```
3. Configure the InfluxDB plugin: You will need to configure the Glances InfluxDB plugin with the connection details for your InfluxDB instance. You can do this by editing the Glances configuration file (`/etc/glances/glances.conf`) and adding the following section:
```makefile
[influxdb]
host = <influxdb_host>
port = <influxdb_port>
user = <influxdb_user>
password = <influxdb_password>
database = <influxdb_database>
```
Replace the placeholders (`<influxdb_host>`, `<influxdb_port>`, `<influxdb_user>`, `<influxdb_password>`, and `<influxdb_database>`) with the appropriate values for your InfluxDB instance.
4. Start Glances with the InfluxDB plugin: You can start Glances with the InfluxDB plugin enabled by running the following command:
```bash
glances -w -C /etc/glances/glances.conf
```
This will start Glances in web server mode (`-w`) and load the configuration file with the InfluxDB plugin settings (`-C /etc/glances/glances.conf`).
5. Verify that data is being sent to InfluxDB: Once Glances is running with the InfluxDB plugin enabled, you can verify that data is being sent to InfluxDB by checking the `glances` measurement in your InfluxDB database. You can use the InfluxDB web interface or CLI to do this.

Here is an example query that you can use to retrieve data from the `glances` measurement:
```sql
SELECT * FROM "glances" WHERE "client"='<glances_client_name>'
```
Replace `<glances_client_name>` with the name of the system where Glances is running.
6. Set up Grafana: Finally, you can set up Grafana to visualize the Glances data stored in InfluxDB. You will need to create a new dashboard in Grafana and add a new panel that uses the InfluxDB data source to query the `glances` measurement. You can use the Grafana query editor to create queries and visualize the data in various ways.
